# Drone News 48h Brief — November 29, 2025

_Window: last 48 hours; 64 incidents._

## Summary
Over the last 48 hours, several drone incidents have been reported across various regions, notably in Eastern Europe and the Middle East. Russian drones have been a significant concern, reportedly flying over Moldova and Romania. Additionally, a drone attack in Russia caused a fire at an oil refinery, highlighting vulnerabilities in critical infrastructure. In Tajikistan, drone-related terrorism was condemned by Iran following increasing tensions. Meanwhile, prison escapes utilizing drone-delivered tools were reported in France, illustrating an ongoing trend of smuggling via drones. Notably, the U.S. has seen an uptick in investigations into drone crashes involving Amazon, affecting services in Texas. These incidents reflect emerging challenges in drone security and regulatory measures needed to enhance safety and counteract illegal activities.

**By category:** airport: 4 • arrest: 4 • crash: 10 • other: 30 • security: 1 • smuggling: 8 • terrorism: 7
**Top queries:** drone incident (20), drone crash (11), drone terrorism (11), drone prison (6), drone smuggling (6)
